item.title: Obama calls Kamala Harris the 'Best Looking Attorney General'
item.description: President Barack Obama praised California attorney General Kamala Harris at a recent fundraiser in Atherton, California: her smarts, her strength, and her babeness. One of those things is not like the other! More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: Woman In Canada Posts Picture to Instagram, Gets Arrested Three Days Later
item.description: A woman in Qu√©bec was recently arrested after posting a photo to Instagram, because Jesus fucking Christ, says the police, do we really need another filtered photograph of a girl with pastel-colored nail polish holding a cup cake? Put her in jail and throw away the key! More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Roger Ebert's Twenty Best Reviews
item.description: Roger Ebert was anything but your stereotypical snobbish film critic; he was a man who would review anything. He was also what some have called "a stealth feminist", though perhaps he was less stealth than he appeared. Though he's been praised for his amazing take-downs, Ebert also had a way to delicately lifting up movies that made you feel light inside to read about them. Here are some of his best reviews of the worst and best reviews of the best. More »
item.dc:creator: Kate Dries

item.title: The NYC Fast Food Strike Matters For Women
item.description: Hundreds of NYC fast food workers walked out of jobs at McDonald's, KFC, and Burger King today in what organizers say is the largest-ever strike against the basically union-free industry. The Fast Food Forward campaign is calling for an industry wage of $15 an hour in the city — that's double what most employees make — and the unionization of fast food restaurants. More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: March Madness Elite Eight Naturally Includes an Eight Ball
item.description: Welcome the the Elite Eight! Yesterday, voters decided to say no to D.A.R.E and yes to MTV (Daren the Lion would be so disappointed in you) and poor Monica Lewinsky still can't catch a break, having lost to the Seattle Sound by a whopping 3,670 votes. Oh, well. She can always go back to her career as a purse designer. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Tennessee Girl Suspended from School 24 Times for Smelling Foul
item.description: A Tennessee second grader at an unidentified elementary school in Washington County has been sent home repeatedly from school for smelling so bad that teachers and students have complained that they are unable to focus on school activities in her smelly presence. More »
item.dc:creator: Meher Ahmad

item.title: My Roger Ebert Story
item.description: Famed film critic and all-around brilliant human being Roger Ebert passed away today at the age of 70. Herewith, a personal essay, which originally appeared on Deadspin in March of 2010. More »
item.dc:creator: Will Leitch

item.title: Roger Ebert Is Dead
item.description: Legendary film critic Roger Ebert died of cancer today. He was 70. To say he will be missed is an understatement. More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: The Concept of a 'Bikini Body' Is Infuriating Bullshit
item.description: It's that time of the year again (in the Northern Hemisphere at least). It's the time when everyone begins to realize that the sleet and the snow are going to end and people will actually want to wear swimsuits. In tandem, it seems like every site on the internet (or sign on the street) is telling you the right way to make your body "bikini ready." More »
item.dc:creator: The Lingerie Lesbian

item.title: It is with a heavy heart we report that...
item.description: It is with a heavy heart we report that legendary film critic Roger Ebert (@ebertchicago) has passed away More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Lululemon Fires Exec Responsible For Those See-Through Pants
item.description: Lululemon has fired its Chief Product Officer, Sheree Waterson, in the wake of the costly recall of the company's transparent yoga pants. Since the recall began — and since other examples of Lululemon's questionable quality-control have emerged in the media — the company's share price has fallen by 16% and it had to revise its sales and earnings forecasts. [Bloomberg] More »
item.dc:creator: Jenna Sauers

item.title: Chris Matthews Wonders if Ladies Really Care About 'Wife Beating'
item.description: More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: The Fraggles Were Actually Incredibly Depressed
item.description: If you want to watch the most whimsical looking, snuggliest adorable moppets say some of the saddest shit you've ever heard, you've come to the right place. How can something so huggable make you want to hold your knees to your chest and rock in the corner for the rest of the day? More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck

item.title: Baylor University Baller Brittney Griner Might Get a Shot at the NBA, But Should She Take It?
item.description: Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban caused a bit of a stir on Tuesday night when he said that he had "no problem whatsoever" with allowing Baylor University centre and women's college basketball's all-time leading shot-blocker Brittney Griner a chance to try out for a spot on Dallas' summer league team. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Your Boyfriend Ryan Gosling Is So Hot When He's a Stone-Faced Killer
item.description: There's a lot of red in the red-band Only God Forgives trailer. Red neon titles, red lanterns, blood-red blood. And your boyfriend Ryan Gosling looks freaking hot when bathed in red light. He also looks hot when he's silently crushing someone's leg with a kick and then dragging that person down a hallway by that person's teeth. "Wanna fight?" he asks. Yes. Yes, I do. If by fight you mean press my tongue to the spot where your neck meets your shoulder. More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Sorry, Virginia Attorney General, But 'Sodomy' Is Not A Crime Against Nature Because Nature Loves Sodomy
item.description: Has it already been 22 days since Virginia overturned its Crimes Against Nature law, allowing consenting adults to have oral and anal sex with impunity? It feels like it's been much shorter than that, but I guess time flies when you are allowing your own citizens to make a cruel mockery of Mother Nature within the privacy of the hell caves they are calling bedrooms. More »
item.dc:creator: Callie Beusman

item.title: Georgia Teens Fight for Racially Integrated Prom Because It's 2013, for Chrissakes
item.description: Black and white students at Wilcox County High School in south Georgia aren't allowed to go to the same prom. Instead, students and parents sponsor segregated proms — yep, in 2013 — and kids that break the skin-dress code are barred entry from the caucasian rager. A mixed-race group of friends who hang out all of the time but can't wear corsages and dance to Top 40 together are trying to encourage their peers to participate in a radical social experiment called NOT BEING RACIST. More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: Living Together Without Getting Married Is the 'New' Norm
item.description: Unmarried couples who cohabitate are staying together longer than they used to, much to Patti Stanger and your grandma's dismay. According to the first federal data on the issue, out today, more of them are having children, too, even without paying a shit ton of money to walk down an aisle first. More »
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: Online Demand Brings Goosebump-Inducing 'Girl Rising' to Theaters
item.description: Have you heard about Girl Rising, a unique documentary that is also kind of a reenactment? Narrated by big-name actresses like Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway, Salma Hayek, Frieda Pinto, Meryl Streep and Kerry Washington, the film is not just a film but a global campaign; the organizers explain: "We use the power of storytelling and the leverage of strategic partnerships to deliver a single message: educating girls in developing nations will change the world." More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Cursive Is Dead and There Is Nothing You Can Do to Bring It Back
item.description: The cursive alphabet lies in a hospital bed, its lettered chest rising and falling less and less with each breath. Sometimes you think that it's stopped breathing altogether, but then suddenly, somewhere around the twisted letter G, appears a terrible shutter and it begins all over again. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Beyonc√©'s New Pepsi Ad Features Flawless Beyonc√© in a Room of Flawless Beyonc√©s
item.description: Look, I'm not stupid enough to believe that Beyonc√© drinks soda, but I do believe that she can, sorceress-like, conjure doppelg√§ngers of herself to dance with and shatter a room full of mirrors with one whip of her hair. No question. More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Shoe Salesman Accused of Trying to Cut off Woman's Toes Three Times
item.description: Daniel Anaya, a former New Mexico shoe salesman who's previously been accused of biting off part of his now ex-girlfriend's toe (SHUDDER), is back at it. Santa Fe police say Anaya recently tried to use a cigar cutter to cut off the big toe of the same woman he terrorized with his teeth. DUDE. More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck

item.title: New Gatsby Posters Show Leo and Carey in Art Deco Heaven
item.description: Leonardo DiCaprio is the king of the Carey Mulligan, Tobey Maguire, Joel Edgerton, Isla Fisher, and Elizabeth Debicki in this just released poster for Baz Luhrmann's Gatsby. This is not going to be a subtle film, friends. More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck

item.title: The One Hot Guy on Girls Quits Because He Can't Stand Lena Dunham
item.description: Say goodbye to sadsacky-turned-sexier Zuckerbergian Charlie, Marnie's (Allison Williams') chewtoy on Girls (have you guys even heard of this show? Because like NOBODY talks about it). Actor Christopher Abbott and the Prince mustache he sports in his downtime have "abruptly" departed from the HBO show shortly after Lena Dunham and co. began working on Season 3. More »
item.dc:creator: Anna Breslaw

item.title: What if Taylor Swift Sang About Being 32?
item.description: Perhaps these are the things she'd sing about — having acne and wrinkles at the same time, and joining Weight Watchers. I guess we'll just have to wait ten years to find out if Tay Tay is monologuing about this sort of everyday stuff, or if she's belting about the number of koala bears who inhabit Taylandia (the country formerly known as Australia; she purchases it in 2020). More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck
